commit.message: JENKINS-61208 Allow system read to view more admin monitors

nodes.bodyText: Unsure about that one, since SYSTEM_READ doesn't grant access to view jobs, and getItemMap bypasses regular Read permission checks. So you'll be told there's stuff there but cannot see it, which seems weird.
While doForward doesn't do anything, it's a small step to something that does, so perhaps just add an unnecessary check?

commit.message: Don't show views monitor if no access

nodes.bodyText: Potential i18n problem? I'd be happy with confirming the element exists.
Why does this one allow to submit the yes? SYSTEM_READ does have access to view the information the button is redirecting to?

nodes.bodyText:
I took the assumption that it’s highly unlikely that you wouldn’t be able to see jobs and it’s more of a quirk of the permissions system that it doesn’t automatically grant you read access,

Good enough from my point of view

Would make more sense if you accessed items (and views) through a method performing permission checks.

Could be a good improvement I would be happy to see Lazy loading for jobs eventually, and the implementation would require a change after that. But it would be the least of the problems we would have
